intro: Larnax dilloniana, commonly known as the Dillon's larnax, is a rare and unique plant native to specific regions of Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees, and is characterized by its aromatic leaves and flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are small and clustered, often displaying a range of colors from white to pink, and it produces small, woody fruits. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Larnax dilloniana is considered a vulnerable species.
